basics.name: Sundar Gurumurthy
basics.label: Computation Modelling Engineer
basics.summary: Enthusiastic early career professional with 3+ years of experience in FE analysis with a Master's degree in engineering.

work.name: Cranfield University
work.summary: Supporting process modelling activities at the Welding and Additive Manufacturing Centre. The centre consists of the foremost experts on Wire Arc Additive Manufacturing(WAAM) and supports the aerospace, energy and mining industries.
highlights: Liased with industry partners to optimise WAAM processes parameters for microstructure, strength and defect mitigation using FE models
Developed new surface heat source model which considers the curvature of weld bead.
Implemented thermo-metallurgical predictions using Solid State Phase Transformation (SSPT).
Designed and performed validation experiments using WAAM processes such as CW-MIG & PTA.

work.name: Sona Comstar
work.summary: Part of the bevel gear design team. Sona Comstar is one of the world's largest manufacturers of bevel gears and differential assemblies with close to 10% share in the global passenger vehicle market.
highlights: Developed in-house software for macro and micro design of bevel gear geometry with integrations to share design data to Siemens NX and Team Centre.
Created mathematical models to generate Bezier surfaces for optimised bevel gear contact patterns.
Liased with international customers to design bevel gears with complete involvement from Request for Quote to production handover.

work.name: Mercedes Benz R&D India
work.summary: FE modelling of car crashes as part of the Crash Structures team.
highlights: Developed non-linear FE models of fibre reinforced composites in rubber tires for low speed car crash simulations.
Studied the impace of various air pressure models of tyres on the lagrangian contact at tyre-road interface.
Develivered the test plan for verification of the model for low speed car crashes.

work.name: Daimler India Commercial Vehicles
work.summary: In-Plant trainee at the End of Line department for rework processes of Mitsubishi FUSO trucks
highlights: Conducted lean manufacturing study for various rework processes and reduced non-value added activities, increasing overall efficiency by 0.5%.
Conducted root cause analysis for rework processes and developed plan to mitigate defects.

courses: Thesis: Understanding and Improving the Inherent Strain Method for Mechanical Analysis of Wire Arc Additive Manufacturing.
Supervisors: Dr Yongle Sun & Dr Pradeeptta Taraphdar

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science Pilani

awards.title: AIAA SmallSat Student Travel Award
awards.summary: Financial award for high achieving undergraduates to travel and present at the 33rd SmallSat conference. Funded by industry partners such as Blue Origin, OneWeb etc.

publications.abstract: This paper presents a study on residual stress measurement in wire-arc additively manufactured (WAAM) titanium samples using the non-destructive method of phased array ultrasonics. The contour method (CM) was used for the verification of the phased array ultrasonic results. This allowed for a comparison of measurement methods to understand the effects on the distribution of residual stress (RS) within Ti-6Al-4V samples and the effectiveness of measurement of residual stress using phased array ultrasonics. From the results of the experiments, the phased array ultrasonic data were found to be in good agreement with the CM results and displayed similar residual stress distributions in the samples. The results of the individual elements of the phased array were also compared and an improvement in accuracy was found. From per-element results, anomalies were found and could be mitigated with the ability to average the results by using phased array ultrasonics. Therefore, based on these results, there is a strong case for the benefits of using phased array ultrasonics as a method of residual stress measurement for WAAM Ti-6Al-4V components over other existing residual stress measurement techniques.
publications.name: Study of residual stress using phased array ultrasonics in Ti-6Al-4V wire-arc additively manufactured components

publications.publisher: Proceedings of the International Astronautical Congress(IAC), Washington D.C.
publications.name: Development and testing of an antenna deployment system for nanosatellite applications

highlights: Tutored teenagers from impoverished backgrounds who were enrolled as part of India's Right to Education Program
Volunteered in donation drives to collect money to fund student scholarships
